required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: a Vigibase Pharmacovigilance Study of ENzalutamide Drug-induced neurotoxicitY
clinical_study.official_title: Monitoring the Neurological Toxicity of Enzalumatide Through VigiBase, a Pharmacovigilance Study

brief_summary.textblock: Enzalutamide may lead to various adverse reactions. This study investigates reports of different neurological toxicities in the World Health Organization's (WHO) global database of individual safety case reports (VigiBase).

detailed_description.textblock: Enzalutamide are responsible of a wide range of side effects.The investigators use VigiBase, the World Health Organization (WHO) database of individual safety case reports, to identify cases of adverse drug reactions following treatment with enzalutamide

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with neurological adverse events with significant over-reporting enzalutamide
primary_outcome.time_frame: Case reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) of individual safety case reports to January 2020
primary_outcome.description: Identification and report of neurological toxiciy of enzalutamdie

arm_group.description: Cases reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) and the French pharmacovigilance database of patients treated by enzalutamide, with a chronology compatible with the drug toxicity

intervention.description: Enzalutamide for the treatment of prostate cancer or other solid tumors

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated with enzalutamide for prostate cancer or other solid tumors

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Case reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) database of individual safety case reports to 01/01/2020 Adverse events reported were including any MedDRA terms Patients treated with enzalutamide reported in the WHO database.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronology not compatible between the drug and the toxicity
